front.title: Concerns around the Applicability of RFC 4474

abstract.t: RFC 4474 defines a mechanism for secure identification of callers inthe Session Initiation Protocol (SIP). This mechanism has been usedas the foundation for some recent additional work, includingconnected party identification, anti-spam, and secure media.However, concerns have been raised about the applicability of RFC4474 in real deployments and the actual level of security services itprovides. This document describes those concerns.
